notes: Can explode cloud by kicking it to extend hitbox with identical knockback properties. Cloud explosion is active for 3 frames, which is extended to 12 frames due to 9 frames of hitpause. The last 3 frames of hitpause will decay the base knockback by 1.5, which then remains at 4.5 BKB until the move is no longer active.

Can explode cloud by kicking it to extend hitbox with identical knockback properties. Cloud explosion is active for 3 frames, which is extended to 12 frames due to 9 frames of hitpause. The last 3 frames of hitpause will decay the base knockback by 1.5, which then remains at 5.5 BKB until the move is no longer active.

downSpecial.name: Cloud Bomb
notes: Interrupting Absa by hitting her before the cloud is primed will prevent the hitbox from becoming active, however the cloud will still remain. If a cloud does not exist and Absa is interuppted before frame 24, one will not be created.
Starting the timer on down-special (f33) begins a 40 frame cooldown on both cloud hop and forward-special, preventing a new cloud from being created during the initial charge time of the cloud bomb.
Once the cloud bomb has finished detonating (after the last active frame) you are able to use it again after a 12 frame cooldown.
Cloud will despawn on Absa's death.

downSpecial.name: Charged to Absa
notes: Once the cloud bomb has finished detonating (after the last active frame) you are able to use it again after a 12 frame cooldown.

Can explode cloud by kicking it to extend hitbox with identical knockback properties. Cloud explosion is active for 3 frames, which is extended to 12 frames due to 9 frames of hitpause. The last 3 frames of hitpause will decay the base knockback by 1.5, which then remains at 6.5 BKB until the move is no longer active.

hitboxes.name: Jab 2
notes: Jab 2 loops back into Jab 1.
If jab is held 1 frame prior to the next part of Absa's jab loop the next hitbox will become active on the next frame, technically making the startup of her jab loops 0.
If you hit another character or object at any time during the jab loop, Absa is able to cancel into a turnaround tilt at any point in the loop afterwards.

hitboxes.name: Cloud Hop
notes: Interrupting Absa by hitting her during the cloud hop startup will prevent the cloud from being created.
Cloud will despawn on Absa's death.

hitboxes.name: Cloud Pop
notes: Interrupting Absa by hitting her during the first 3 frames of startup before the cloud startup begins will prevent the hitbox from becoming active, however the cloud will still remain.

neutralSpecial.name: Thunder Line
notes: Releasing the charge at any time before frame 15 will cause Absa to transition immediately into cloud pop, with the cloud exploding 5 frames later.

Interrupting Absa by hitting her before the thunder bolt becomes active will prevent both hitboxes from becoming active, however the cloud will still remain. Hitting Absa on the first active frame of the thunder line (f29) will cause the bolt to be active for only 1 frame, however the cloud will still explode at its regular time.

The endlag window for Absa's forward special will always begin on frame 54 if you are still controlling the cloud, however you are still able to control and place the cloud until frame 69, after which the cloud locks into place and begins its 8 frames of startup.
Interrupting Absa by hitting her while she is in forward special or during cloud's 8 frames of startup will prevent the hitbox from becoming active, however the cloud will still remain.
Cloud will automatically be placed and begin to detonate upon contact of either a wall or solid object, such as Kragg/Shovel Knight rock or Kragg pillar.
Cloud will despawn on Absa's death, however if the stock is lost during Forward Special the cloud will still be controllable and placed as normal without despawing.

hitboxes.name: Zip 1
notes: Can shift the up-special angle downwards slightly while travelling horizontally in the air by inputting fast-fall.
Snaps to the ledge within 16px while moving horizontally.

hitboxes.name: Zip 2
notes: Can shift the up-special angle downwards slightly while travelling horizontally in the air by inputting fast-fall.
Snaps to the ledge within 16px while moving horizontally.

When travelling from ground to air, Absa will cancel part of the endlag and be actionable without going into pratfall. This also applies when touching the ground with the first part of up special before becoming airborne again.
On hitting a character or object, it is possible to cancel the remaining active frames into up strong. This may be input during hitpause to begin immediately after hitpause has ended.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1-2
notes: Plasma Field is not created if parried.

hitboxes.name: Hit 3 Tipper
notes: Plasma Field is not created if parried.

hitboxes.name: Plasma Field
notes: Reflects all projectiles on contact with the field.
Destroys all enemy projectiles spawned within the field.
Shrinks toward the center of the field during the final 7 frames of its lifetime.

hitboxes.name: Grab
notes: Can shift downwards while airborne after a succesful grab by inputting fast-fall.

hitboxes.name: Forward Throw
notes: Window to input direction of throw is f20-39. On f40 Clairen will begin throwing the grabbed character forward by default.

hitboxes.name: Back Throw
notes: Window to input direction of throw is f20-39. On f40 Clairen will begin throwing the grabbed character forward by default.

hitboxes.name: Sour
notes: If on the ground when cancelling you can hold back and jump to turnaround on the first frame of jump-squat.
Clairen does not enter pratfall on hit.

hitboxes.name: Sweet
notes: Clairen does not enter pratfall on hit.

hitboxes.name: Slash
notes: Earliest frame to input is 23 (as early as frame 17 buffering on whiff). Last frame to input is 33. Startup always begins on frame 34.
Mine takes 100 frames to become active if stuck on a player.

downSpecial.name: Plant Mine
notes: Can be hit away by attacks and projectiles while active. The speed and angle in which the mine will travel upon being hit in mid-air is relative to the base knockback and knockback angle of the attack.
Mine will automatically explode when hitting certain articles. These include Sylvanos' Flowers, Vince (Pomme), Ranno's Bubble and Olympia's Crystal.
Mine will not stick to the last person to hit it and cannot be stuck to Elliana.

hitboxes.name: Hit 3
notes: Destroys mine if stuck to player.

hitboxes.name: Steam Eject
notes: Air acceleration while charging strong attacks is multiplied by 0.5x.

hitboxes.name: Steam
notes: Ignores players in the first 9 frames of hitstun.
Cannot hit mine.

downStrong.name: Steam
notes: Transparent steam clouds are inactive until grouping up with other clouds.
Parrying steam will change the ownership of all active steam of that player.
Hitting another character and steam at the same time will move the steam further than it would otherwise.
Air acceleration while charging strong attacks is multiplied by 0.5x.
Heat reduction is paused during startup/charge frames.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Has the ability to knock a Planted Mine a short distance directly upwards from the ground.

hitboxes.name: Steam Eject
notes: Air acceleration while charging strong attacks is multiplied by 0.5x.

hitboxes.name: Steam
notes: Ignores players in the first 9 frames of hitstun.
Cannot hit mine.

forwardStrong.name: Steam
notes: Transparent steam clouds are inactive until grouping up with other clouds.
Parrying steam will change the ownership of all active steam of that player.
Hitting another character and steam at the same time will move the steam further than it would otherwise.
Air acceleration while charging strong attacks is multiplied by 0.5x.
Heat reduction is paused during startup/charge frames.

hitboxes.name: Fist
notes: Cannot be broken by projectiles that deal <8%.
Fist begins exploding on contact with the ground, walls, objects, or an active mine while travelling. Passes through characters without exploding unless they are stickied with an active mine.
Knockback is increased on hitting an active mine, conveyed visually by a red explosion animation rather than the regular orange one.

sideSpecial.name: Uncharged Missile
notes: Control over the missile is lost on death.
Missiles do not have an explosion hitbox, so a hidden pillar destruction hitbox with a radius of 32px will appear on missile exploding.

sideSpecial.name: Charged Missile
notes: Cannot be broken by attacks or projectiles.
Does not break upon hitting the ground at certain angles, but will instead slide along it, lowering the missile's speed.
Control over the missile is lost on death.
Missiles do not have an explosion hitbox, so a hidden pillar destruction hitbox with a radius of 64px will appear on missile exploding.
You can control the height that Elliana is ejected to by holding a vertical direction on f8 of Up Special.
Ejecting from the mech refreshes airdodge if it has already been used.
Elliana's mines begin falling from the characters they were stuck to on f4 of eject.

hitboxes.name: Steam Eject
notes: Air acceleration while charging strong attacks is multiplied by 0.5x.

hitboxes.name: Steam
notes: Ignores players in the first 9 frames of hitstun.
Cannot hit mine.

upStrong.name: Steam
notes: Transparent steam clouds are inactive until grouping up with other clouds.
Parrying steam will change the ownership of all active steam of that player.
Hitting another character and steam at the same time will move the steam further than it would otherwise.
Air acceleration while charging strong attacks is multiplied by 0.5x.
Heat reduction is paused during startup/charge frames.

hitboxes.name: Claw
notes: On grabbing multiple characters, the claw will use port-priority to decide which opponent to lock on to.
Launch opponent in the opposite direction by inputting away while they are still in the chain.

hitboxes.name: Launch
notes: If dodge is not held, Up Tilt Hit 2 will consume all heat to increase the base knockback, knockback scaling, and endlag of the move.

hitboxes.name: On Ice (Max)
notes: Starting on ice and then moving onto normal ground will end active frames early.
Holding back on the same frame you jump-cancel will cause Etalus to turnaround on the last frame of jumpsquat.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1-2
notes: On hit, Etalus stalls in the air slightly to assist with the next hitbox connecting. Holding down during dair will cause him to fall normally. Inputting a fast-fall will hitfall the move as normal.

hitboxes.name: Falling (Grounded)
notes: Cooldown begins on first falling active frame.

hitboxes.name: Falling (Airborne)
notes: Cooldown begins on first falling active frame.

hitboxes.name: Landing
notes: Deals knockback to airborne opponents, grounded opponents will instead be frozen.
Any ice on-stage will freeze grounded characters once it is activated with the shockwave that is created by down special's landing hitbox.
This shockwave prevents any ice from disappearing, even if it is currently in it's melting animation.
Hitpause frames extend lifetime, including Clairen's tipper stun.
Frozen character's tech direction is locked in when the ice cracks on f65.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Can only hit airborne characters.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Can only hit airborne characters.

hitboxes.name: Shards
notes: Active frames increase by up to 4 frames and speed increases from a base value of 14px/frame to 18px/frame linearly based on charge.

downStrong.name: Ice Armored
notes: Strong attack charge increases weak armour values from 10-25 linearly until Etalus reaches half charge, at which point he gains super armour on the attack 2 frames after releasing the charge.

Hit 2 has varying startup depending on when the attack is input. An attack input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

hitboxes.name: Armor
notes: Armoring through an attack counts as a hit for landing lag values.

hitboxes.name: Shards
notes: Active frames increase by up to 4 frames and speed increases from a base value of 14px/frame to 18px/frame linearly based on charge.

forwardStrong.name: Ice Armored
notes: Strong attack charge increases weak armour values from 10-25 linearly until Etalus reaches half charge, at which point he gains super armour on the attack 2 frames after releasing the charge.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

neutralSpecial.name: Ice Hammer
notes: Ice Armor generated f64 on ice.

Ice Armor is broken after 40% of damage is taken or is removed immediately upon being parried. Etalus must also be placed in hitstun for armour to break from an attack, meaning moves like Ori's Spirit Flame or Maypul's seed are unable to break armor despite dealing damage.
Ice cannot disappear while Etalus is using Neutral Special.
Cooldown applies both on f12 and on the last frame of endlag.
Interrupting Etalus anytime during forward special will cause the icicles to either not spawn or break, becoming inactive immediately.

hitboxes.name: Grab
notes: Cancels remaining active frames on hit.

hitboxes.name: Throw
notes: Active 1 further frame due to hitpause when throwing characters.
Timing of active frames is determined by which frame of grab hits.
Air brakes on frame 5 except for when cancelling the first 4 frames of double-jump into Up Special, in which case Etalus' vertical speed is set to 0 instantly.
Cancelling with airdodge anytime before endlag f4 will allow you to use Up Special again without walljumping or touching the ground.
Air brakes on frame 5 except for when cancelling the first 4 frames of double-jump into Up Special, in which case Etalus' vertical speed is set to 0 instantly.
Cancelling with airdodge anytime before endlag f4 will allow you to use Up Special again without walljumping or touching the ground.

upSpecial.name: Ice Armored
notes: Armoured Up Special travels slightly less distance vertically in comparison to the non-armoured versions at the same level of charge, however you are able to act sooner due to decreased endlag and an earlier cancel window as a result.

hitboxes.name: Shards
notes: Active frames increase by up to 4 frames and speed increases from a base value of 14px/frame to 18px/frame linearly based on charge.

upStrong.name: Ice Armored
notes: Strong attack charge increases weak armour values from 10-25 linearly until Etalus reaches half charge, at which point he gains super armour on the attack 2 frames after releasing the charge.
Successfully consumed f19 in smoke.

hitboxes.name: Sweet
notes: Sweetspot is in the center of combust.
Interrupting Forburn anytime during this move will cause him to lose his smoke charges.

Dagger has varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A dagger input after the first 5 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.
Releases 5-10 clouds of smoke unless interrupted by Forsburn being hit (barring flinch) or performing another special, both of which cause all smoke to become active.

During each release interval if Forsburn is within a patch of smoke it will skip that cycle and guarantee that the next interval will spawn smoke instead, with the exception of the second interval which always spawns smoke.

hitboxes.name: Empowered
notes: Interrupting Forsburn before frame 10 will cause him to lose his smoke charges and not release any smoke.

neutralSpecial.name: Release Smoke
notes: There can be a maximum of 20 smoke clouds shared by all Forsburns at once in a given game, with new clouds of smoke removing the oldest active smoke cloud.
Active smoke hides Forsburn's movements whenever he is not attacking, allows him to create a clone or teleport into it silently and invisibly, and is consumable with down-special.
Active smoke can also be destroyed by enemy characters. Upon being destroyed, smoke remains active for 12 frames before disappearing.
Inactive smoke does not conceal the player and cannot be destroyed or interacted with in any way.
Forsburn's neutral special will be disabled if there is inactive smoke or an active clone in play.

hitboxes.name: Create Clone
notes: Clone Spawns f23, hurtbox appears f25 (Can spawn Smoke upon death from f25-). Clone is active f26-.

hitboxes.name: Clone Combust
notes: Clone will be removed 14 frames after active frames have ended, after which  cooldown will begin.

sideSpecial.name: Clone
notes: A single cloud of smoke is created upon hitting and destroying clone.
Clone is instantly destroyed upon hitting Forsburn.
Pressing neutral or side special while clone is active toggles between Attack and Evade movement patterns.
Holding special after spawning a clone will prevent him from jumping, walljumping or using Up Special. On releasing special, the clone will double jump, walljump or Up Special 10 frames later.
If the clone has their Up Special parried it will disappear immediately without leaving a smoke cloud.
Creating a clone whilst hiding behind smoke will not play an audio cue.
The cooldown indicator will remain active on creating a clone and will only become inactive on the clone being destroyed or after clone combust has been commanded.

hitboxes.name: Create Clone
notes: Clone Spawns f23, hurtbox appears f25 (Can spawn Smoke upon death from f25-). Clone is active f26-.

hitboxes.name: Clone Combust (Sweet)
notes: Sweetspot is in the center of combust.
Hitting Forsburn during the startup frames of clone combust does not destroy the clone.

sideSpecial.name: Empowered: Super Clone
notes: A single cloud of smoke is created upon hitting and destroying clone.
Clone is instantly destroyed upon hitting Forsburn.
Pressing neutral or side special while super clone is active commands him to attack.
Clone will automatically attack 120 frames from FAF of previous attack.

Super clone's movement is always in attack mode, unless its target is invincible, in which case it will swap to evade mode for the duration of the opposing characters invulnerability and you will be unable to command it to attack.
Holding special after spawning a clone will prevent him from jumping, walljumping or using Up Special. On releasing special, the clone will double jump, walljump or Up Special 10 frames later.
If the clone has their Up Special parried it will disappear immediately without leaving a smoke cloud.
Creating a clone whilst hiding behind smoke will not play an audio cue.
The cooldown indicator will remain active on creating a clone and will only become inactive on the clone being destroyed or after clone combust has been commanded.

Landing immediately out of up-special increases the pratfall landing lag time, causing Forsburn to remain in grounded landing lag for 20 frames after 8 frames of endlag from the teleport. If airborne, Forsburn can control his aerial drift from frame 58 and has a decreased pratfall landing lag value of 10, which make landing directly from the teleport slower than ending Up Special in the air in some circumstances.

hitboxes.name: Into Smoke
notes: Vanishing into active smoke to become immediately actionable after appearing with no active hitbox.
Both silent and invisible.

Dagger has varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A dagger input after the first 5 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

notes: Continues off ledges.

dashAttack.name: EX Charged
notes: Continues off ledges.

hitboxes.name: Rising
notes: Parry cancel does not remove the active hitboxes during its 12 frames of endlag, after which Hodan is either in pratfall on whiff or actionable on hit.
On capturing a Sweatwhirl, a spirit is placed rather than being captured entirely, however Hodan still receives the full benefits of capturing it.
It is not possible to capture Sweatwhirls if they have been parried.
Wall-jumping after capturing a Spirit will place the Spirit at the wall.

hitboxes.name: Slam
notes: Minimum of 12 frames after Rising hitbox has ended before Slam.

hitboxes.name: Slam (Bury)
notes: Minimum of 12 frames after Rising hitbox has ended before Slam.
Only hits and buries grounded characters.

hitboxes.name: Empowered Mud Wave
notes: Only hits and buries grounded characters.
Only spawns if a Sweat Spirit is captured prior to landing.
Bury time of 40 includes 5 frames forced uncancellable jumpsquat.
Airborne with regular fullhop momentum on first active frame.

downStrong.name: EX Charged (Parry Success)
notes: Upon successfully parrying an attack during Charged Down Strong, Hodan transitions into a less powerful splash attack which instead covers a much larger area and is active for an increased period.

hitboxes.name: Late
notes: Hitbox disappears 1f after releasing attack f35- (after hitpause).

Hodan will never go into landing lag at any stage during Nair. Landing during startup causes Hodan to hover above the ground until the first hitbox becomes active, which then causes the landing hitbox to appear one frame later. Landing during endlag continues the aerial endlag frames on the ground, becoming actionable in a grounded state upon ending.

Draws Sweat Spirits towards its tornado for the full duration of the attack, consuming them when they become close enough. It is not possible to capture Sweatwhirls if they have been parried by another character.
Releasing attack at any time after f23 will cause Hodan to instantly enter startup for the final hit.
Hodan can spin for a maximum of 4 times without becoming dizzy during his endlag, increased to 8 spins if he captures a spirit.

Although Hodan is normally only able to have 3 Spirits in the field at once, if able to capture more than 3 spirits during Neutral Special this will extend the maximum number of spins even further than what is listed in the actives frames and FAF.

hitboxes.name: Throw Whirl
notes: Cooldown applied first and last frames of endlag.
Spawns Sweat Spirits on contact with enemy, object, or ground/wall.
A parried Sweatwhirl will not spawn a Sweat Spirit.
Can have 3 Sweat Spirits placed at a time, with the oldest being removed from play if a new one is spawned (Sweatwhirls can still be spawned freely).
All Sweat Spirits are removed on Hodan's death.
Sweat Spirits can only be captured after their spawn animation has finished, being 40 frames after the Sweatwhirl has hit an enemy (post-hitpause), an object, or the ground/wall.

hitboxes.name: Throw Whirl
notes: Cooldown applied first and last frames of endlag.

sideSpecial.name: EX Charged
notes: Spawns Sweat Spirits on contact with enemy, object, or ground/wall.
A parried Sweatwhirl will not spawn a Sweat Spirit.
Can have 3 Sweat Spirits placed at a time, with the oldest being removed from play if a new one is spawned (Sweatwhirls can still be spawned freely).
All Sweat Spirits are removed on Hodan's death.
Sweat Spirits can only be captured after their spawn animation has finished, being 40 frames after the Sweatwhirl has hit an enemy (post-hitpause), an object, or the ground/wall.

hitboxes.name: Late
notes: Walljumping after capturing a Spirit will place the Spirit at the wall.
It is not possible to capture Sweatwhirls if they have been parried.

hitboxes.name: Late
notes: Walljumping after capturing a Spirit will place the Spirit at the wall.
Increased pratfall landing lag of 15 frames.

hitboxes.name: Spirit Toss
notes: If Spirit Toss is repeated more than once per airtime then Hodan will enter pratfall after endlag.

upSpecial.name: EX Charged
notes: It is not possible to capture Sweatwhirls if they have been parried.

hitboxes.name: Grab
notes: Refreshes opponents' double jump on hit.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

hitboxes.name: Spike 1
notes: Interrupting Kragg before frame 13 will prevent this spike from spawning.

hitboxes.name: Spike 2
notes: Interrupting Kragg before frame 14 will prevent this spike from spawning.
Endlag value is based on this summon frame.

hitboxes.name: Spike 3
notes: Interrupting Kragg by hitting him before frame 38 will prevent this spike from spawning.
Landing f1-8 transitions into Grounded Down Special, landing f9-19 reduces startup from 21 to 19, landing f20 reduces startup from 21 to 20.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

neutralSpecial.name: Rock Throw
notes: Rock will be active if falling (off a broken pillar for example) or moved by a hitbox from another character. In this case the rock will deal 7 damage and have a force flinch value of 0, allowing it to be crouch cancelled. A rock which falls from a pillar or platform will deal identical knockback to a rock thrown by down throw (with the damage and force flinch value being altered per above). Attacks which can move the rock (such as Forsburn's cape, Etalus up air etc.) will set the rock's other knockback values to match either forward throw if rock's horizontal speed is greater than 8 or neutral throw if its horizontal speed is 8 or less.
Breaking an airborne rock has 1 additional frame of hitpause due to rock state change.

hitboxes.name: Grounded
notes: Kragg can turnaround after moving on the ground with an active hitbox for 9 frames, causing the hitbox to become inactive but your super armor to remain. The hitbox will remain inactive for 18 frames before becoming active again if in the active window.

sideSpecial.name: Pillarless Cancel
notes: Destroys existing pillar 2 frames after cancel has been input. Interrupting Kragg on this frame does not prevent the pillar from breaking once pillarless has been input.

upSpecial.name: Pillar
notes: Spawning a pillar increases Kragg's vertical position by 80px.
Pillar's maximum height is dependent on the blastzone height, meaning active frames and FAF may vary slightly.
Breaking pillar adds 10 frames hitpause.
Crouch cancelling a pillar will prevent your character from entering hitstun at all. Air-dodging down towards a pillar while it's rising will make you waveland onto it.

Pillar has full invulnerability while rising and then projectile invulnerability for 60 frames afterwards. Successfully parrying a move while on the pillar will provide the pillar projectile invulnerability for 60 frames.

If a character or rock is on the pillar anytime after 90 frames of it being spawned the pillar will slowly move downwards. If a character leaves the pillar unoccupied while it is descending it will continue to fall for a further 20 frames before stopping. Each time a character re-lands and leaves the pillar unoccupied following this will increase the time Pillar falls while unoccupied for a further 5 frames i.e. 20 frames, 25 frames, 30 frames and so on.

If a character is on the pillar when it is broken they will go into prat-fall unless they are currently invulnerable, in which case they will lose their invulnerability. If you are wrapped by Maypul and standing on a pillar as it is broken you will float in place and will not enter prat-fall upon becoming actionable. Prat-fall landing lag is 30 frames if you are on the pillar when it is broken for all characters.
If both sides of the pillar sink into the stage floor it will break immediately.

upSpecial.name: Pillarless
notes: Destroys existing pillar on 2nd frame of animation. Interrupting Kragg on this frame does not prevent the pillar from breaking once pillarless has been input.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Pulls opponents inwards during hitpause.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Repositions characters during hitpause, scaling based on how late into the active frames it hits.
Interrupting Maypul before frame 8 will prevent root from spawning.

downSpecial.name: Place Lily
notes: Lily will spit an active seed up in the air upon eating it. If this seed does not collide with another character, object or platform it will then be swallowed by Lily again, resetting her lifetime duration a second time before disappearing.
Maypul can place Lily again during Lily's despawn animation, as well as during the hitpause of Lily's bite.
Lily will always start her attack 1 frame after detecting an opponent in her range, increasing her effective startup by 1. This is reflected in the animation for the attack.

downSpecial.name: Lily's Bite
notes: Maypul can place Lily again during Lily's despawn animation, as well as during the hitpause of Lily's bite.
If Bite is initiated by a character with Watcher's Mark but does not succesfully hit them, that character's Watcher's Mark will be removed.

downSpecial.name: Aerial
notes: Holding down allows Down Special to travel through platforms.

hitboxes.name: Jab 2
notes: Jab 2 loops back into Jab 1.
Varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.
If you hit another character or object at any time during the jab loop, Maypul is able to cancel into a turnaround tilt at any point in the loop afterwards.
Endlag is doubled on whiff if started either on the ground or within 32px of it, so long as the move was also not reversed and the endlag does not begin while airborne.
Snaps to the ledge within 20px.
Aerial forward special will travel further than grounded forward special.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1-2
notes: Doubled knockback scaling after cancelling Tether endlag into Up Air makes it easier to DI up to escape the final hit.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: On being parried, Maypul is unable to drop through platforms for a short period of time, extending a few frames into the pratfall state.

upSpecial.name: Tether
notes: Tether's travel time scales with distance, the direction you travel to (Above, In Front, Behind) and whether the marked player is in hitstun or not. Tether travel time is 3 times faster when the marked player is in hitstun and a minimum 5 frames slower when they are not.
Hitstun distinction registered at the start of tether.
Cancelling tether endlag into Up Air will double the knockback scaling of the move's multi-hits.
Maypul has the ability to tether to any character that has been wrapped as if they are marked and in hitstun.
Picks up bombs f9 to transition into bomb throw.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Unique turnaround window.
Possible to change your direction on f11 of startup.

downSpecial.name: Bat
notes: If a bomb is equipped on using down special, it will be moved to the tip of the bat, immediately detonating on f42.
Holding forward when striking any of the Bombs while airborne will send them much further during their detonation time.
Hold left or right on frame 17 to slide with reduced endlag.
Cannot slide if Down Strong is parried.

hitboxes.name: Toss
notes: Bomb will be hit out of Mollo's hands if interrupted after startup. Mollo will not drop the bomb if interrupted while charging.

hitboxes.name: Bomb
notes: Bomb spawns inactive f10 if grounded, but will gain a bonk hitbox if charged for at least 30f.

downStrong.name: Bomb Toss
notes: On fully charging, bomb will become unstable immediately on being thrown regardless of how long is left on the fuse timer.
Strong attack charge mechanic, which increases the damage of an attack by 1.6x and the total knockback by 1.25x.
Charge time is over a reduced period of 30 frames, with the charge value increasing at twice the regular rate and becoming fully charged on f37.

hitboxes.name: Toss
notes: Bomb will be hit out of Mollo's hands if interrupted after startup. Mollo will not drop the bomb if interrupted while charging.

forwardStrong.name: Bomb Toss
notes: On fully charging, bomb will become unstable immediately on being thrown regardless of how long is left on the fuse timer.

hitboxes.name: Jab 3
notes: Spray can begins refilling after approximately 2 seconds without using it.
Loop endlag begins immediately upon releasing attack.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

hitboxes.name: Pull
notes: On airdodging, bomb is dropped behind Mollo on f5. On parry, bomb is dropped to the ground beneath Mollo on f4.
Holding up selects Cherry Bomb, left selects Firecracker, right selects Flashbang, and down selects Finisher.

hitboxes.name: Bonk
notes: Bombs will not bonk players in hitstun moving faster than 8px/frame.

neutralSpecial.name: Bomb
notes: 120 frame fuse begins f16 of Bomb Pull, after which the bomb will become unstable and detonate 50f later, 50f after being thrown, on impact with a character or surface, or on Mollo being hit.

The exception to this rule is when bomb hits specific objects, such as Sylvanos' Flowers, Ranno's Bubble, and Olympia's Crystal, in which bomb will bounce upwards a short distance regardless of what state it is in.

neutralSpecial.name: Cherry Bomb Explosion
notes: Can be hit and knocked away by physical attacks at 1.8x the attack's base knockback value, avoiding whiff lag.

neutralSpecial.name: Firecracker Explosion
notes: Can be hit and knocked away by physical attacks at 1.8x the attack's base knockback value, avoiding whiff lag.

neutralSpecial.name: Flashbang Explosion
notes: Can be hit and knocked away by physical attacks at 1.8x the attack's base knockback value, avoiding whiff lag.

neutralSpecial.name: Finisher Bomb Explosion
notes: Can be hit and knocked away by physical attacks at 1.6x the attack's base knockback value, avoiding whiff lag.

hitboxes.name: Flare Shot
notes: Interrupting Mollo at any time during startup will prevent Flare Shot hitbox from activating.
If holding a bomb during Side Special, bomb can be hit from Mollo's hands if interrupted after f10 of startup.

sideSpecial.name: Flare
notes: Can be held indefinitely while cursor is in the blastzone.
Flare Shot has a larger hitbox surrounding it which is only able to hit bombs, causing them to become unstable and explode immediately.

hitboxes.name: Launch
notes: Inputting fast-fall on exactly f11 will cause Up Special to descend during its travel time.

If holding a bomb, it will be thrown at the conclusion of the move either diagonally or directly below Mollo based on the chosen direction. Bomb will be active in an unstable state f51 if the move is fully completed, or if the move is cancelled will be active 14f after cancelling and not necessarily unstable.

hitboxes.name: Toss
notes: Bomb will be hit out of Mollo's hands if interrupted after startup. Mollo will not drop the bomb if interrupted while charging.

upStrong.name: Bomb Toss
notes: On fully charging, bomb will become unstable immediately on being thrown regardless of how long is left on the fuse timer.
Olympia will turn around in the air on frame 7.

hitboxes.name: Cancel Dash
notes: Available once per airtime. Refreshes on landing, walljump, or hit.

downSpecial.name: Focus Punch
notes: Canceling Down Special's charge into Unfocused Punch or Cancel Dash removes super armor immediately.

downSpecial.name: Crystallize (Break Out)
notes: Crystallized characters break out and take damage/knockback upon taking 30 damage during Crystallize, touching the ground or wall at any time, or exiting hitstun.

Characters with Super Armour will have the Crystallize effect stored on them, but immediately break out once their attack ends. Hitting a character with a stored Crystallize effect removes it, even if they still have Super Armour upon being hit.

hitboxes.name: Crystals
notes: An extra crystal is added to either side Down Strong on frames 1, 13, 25, 37 and 49 of charging.
All crystals are active at once.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

neutralSpecial.name: Throw Gem
notes: Once thrown, the Gem Field automatically spawns on frame 34 or on hitting another character.
Also automatically spawn on hitting specific destructible objects, being Sylvanos' flowers, Ranno's bubble and an opposing Olympia's Gem.
Once created, Gem can be destroyed by any physical attack or projectile.

neutralSpecial.name: Crystallize (Break Out)
notes: Crystallized characters break out and take damage/knockback upon taking 30 damage during Crystallize, touching the ground or wall at any time, or exiting hitstun.

Characters with Super Armour will have the Crystallize effect stored on them, but immediately break out once their attack ends. Hitting a character with a stored Crystallize effect removes it, even if they still have Super Armour upon being hit.

calculator.description: Calculate travel duration, speed, endlag, damage, and knockback
Calculate travel duration, speed, endlag, damage, and knockback
Calculate travel duration, speed, endlag, damage, and knockback
Calculate travel duration, speed, endlag, damage, and knockback

notes: Unique jump-cancel with 4 frames of jump squat while in Gem Field.
Snaps to ledge within 32px.
Puddle created f12 if in range of ground, otherwise droplet spawns f13.
Cooldown begins when puddle/droplet is spawned.
3 bubbles spawn per frame from f8-23.
Clears air-dodge buffer when hitting grounded characters.

downSpecial.name: Bubbles
notes: Holding a horizontal direction will affect the angle that bubbles travel in.

hitboxes.name: Bubbles
notes: 2 bubbles spawn per frame from f10-33.
Clears air-dodge buffer when hitting grounded characters.

hitboxes.name: Bubble Butt
notes: Fair will only be active once you reach a horizontal speed of 4 pixels per frame.
Maximum horizontal speed of 20 pixels per frame.
Holding a horizontal direction will increase or decrease your horizontal speed during fair, holding a vertical direction will alter the angle that bubbles are blown in.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.
Fall into the ground or a platform during active frames while holding attack to bounce, continuing nair's active frames.
There are two heights you can bounce to, determined by your fall speed (fast-fall for full height).
Can shift downwards while airborne by inputting fast-fall.
Orcane does not enter pratfall on hit.
Can shift downwards while airborne by inputting fast-fall.
Orcane does not enter pratfall on hit.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: New puddle placed f14 if grounded.
If you have an available puddle on stage to teleport to, you can prevent the teleportation by holding parry on frame 18 of Up Special.

hitboxes.name: Falling
notes: Drift horizontally slightly during the startup and active frames of Dair by holding left or right.
Hold down to fall through platforms during the first 5 active frames.

hitboxes.name: Throw
notes: Can angle knockback/launch in full 360 degree inputs.

hitboxes.name: Throw
notes: Can angle launch in full 360 degree inputs.

downSpecial.name: Bash (Projectile)
notes: Bashing a projectile makes Ori invulnerable to other projectiles, however the bashed projectile can still be destroyed by another character and cause Ori to enter the endlag state early and hop up as if releasing Bash.

Upon locking on to a projectile there will be a brief period where Ori becomes invulnerable as the projectile travels into position for the bash. This period increases based on the distance the projectile must travel after being locked in for the bash.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

neutralSpecial.name: Spirit Flame (Taps)
notes: Only causes knockback, hitstun, and hitpause to characters already in hitstun or put into hitstun by another tap within the last 30 frames.

Each spirit flame applies 16 frames of heat to Sein. After 18 frames of endlag, if heat has reached or exceeded a value of 48 Sein will be placed in an inactive cooldown period equal to the heat value. Heat is reduced by 1 each frame f18- after the last hit.
Sein moves 1.5x faster after Spirit Flame is used to reposition itself.

neutralSpecial.name: Charged Flame
notes: Special must be held for at least 16 frames, otherwise an uncharged Spirit Flame attack will occur instead.

Releasing special once the charge has begun before f55 will cause Spirit Flame to stay charged until you tap the button again. Holding the button after f55 will make Sein detonate on releasing special.
Disables all other specials until frame 8 of detonation startup.
Sein continues moving until locked in detonation startup, in which startup can no longer be cancelled and hitting Ori will not interrupt Charged Flame.
Sein will not follow Ori and cannot be used for team up strong attacks for the first 91 frames of endlag if Charged Flame does not hit another character or object.

calculator.description: Calculate throw angle, speed, damage, and knockback
Calculate throw angle, speed, damage, and knockback

cancellable.condition: On Any Hit, w/ Open Parasol

hitboxes.name: Hit 5
notes: Can drift horizontally from f23-.

cancellable.condition: On Any Hit, w/ Open Parasol

upSpecial.name: Parasol
notes: Input fastfall f16-21 to cause Ori to shift downwards slightly after the completion of Up Special. Inputting the fastfall any frame after this will cause Ori to close parasol instead. This mechanic also works with reopen, but the window extends past the active frames, as you are unable to close parasol again for the first 9 frames after initiating your last reopen. Closing parasol is not a bufferable action.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

downSpecial.name: Harmony Field
notes: Pomme is able to float in any direction while within Harmony Field.
Harmony Field will move towards the stage if it is placed far away enough from solid ground.
If Pomme is parried while in float it is instantly cancelled as she enters parry stun.

Fair landing lag scales down over the course of its active frames and endlag, up until the last 5 frames of endlag, which will have default landing lag due to the universal autocancel mechanic. The exception to this is if Pomme lands during the startup of the attack, which will cause Pomme to enter landing lag for 9 frames only instead.

Jab 2 has varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

hitboxes.name: Record Single
notes: Actionable next FAF window upon releasing special.
Stored notes are lost upon being hit or parried.
Recording notes while in float cancels the float, but retains the remaining float time for future use.

hitboxes.name: Release Record
notes: After releasing the first note, remaining stored notes will be released automatically every 44-45f.
If a note interacts with the Harmony Field at any time it will become transcendent, and the horizontal speed will greatly increase for the remainder of its lifetime.
On parrying a note, it will become transcendent when being reflected, allowing it to break other projectiles on its return.

sideSpecial.name: Vince
notes: Vince is spawned 2 frames after and grabs characters hit by Side Special's hitbox 21 frames after charge is released unless Pomme is hit prior to f20 post-release, in which case he will drop to the ground with no active hitbox spawning.

From frames 4-55 post-special release, Vince is able block a single non-transcendent projectile from hitting Pomme, removing it's hitbox as it is travelling. Both projectiles and physical hits will knock Vince away unless Forward Special is fully charged, at which point Vince is able to block all projectiles and withstand any physical hits for his full lifetime.
Vince snaps to the ledge within 16px beneath it.
Active for 2 frames upon hitting the ground before disappearing.

hitboxes.name: Encore
notes: Performed by using Up Special a 2nd time after using it already within Harmony Field without landing, walljumping, or being hit.

If Up Special interacts with Harmony Field at any time, Pomme will be actionable at the end of the move (with 4f additional endlag) with her float restored to the minimum between remaining float time and 45 frames.

hitboxes.name: Create Bubble
notes: Continue holding special f37- to instantly command bubble to move and lower endlag.

hitboxes.name: Move Bubble
notes: Command bubble from f6-.
Tap special to move a short distance or hold for full control until you release special or bubble pops.
Will stall in mid-air once per airtime for up to 51 frames before falling very slowly.

hitboxes.name: Created Bubble
notes: Ranno is still able to air-stall with Down Special during despawn pop animation, making it impossible to buffer a new bubble creation.
Opponents knock bubble 1.5x further than Ranno.

hitboxes.name: Bubble Hitstun
notes: Bubble has a base time of 40 frames before a character escapes.
Each stack of poison adds an additional 40 frames in bubble.
Characters in bubble have their double jump refreshed.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

hitboxes.name: Charge
notes: Being hit while charging neutral special or being parried will cause Ranno to lose all charged darts.
Charge cancel will store an extra dart if the charge frame occurs on the first frame of endlag.

hitboxes.name: Throw
notes: Endlag begins f20, decreasing with the amount of darts thrown.
When landing during an airborne dart throw, the angle of each following dart will change to their grounded angle.
All darts will reflect upon a single dart being parried.

hitboxes.name: Tongue
notes: Unable to swallow any opponent that has been trapped in a bubble in the last 60 frames, will instead spit them back.
If tongue connects with an object, platform, ground, or wall, Ranno will be pulled towards it.
Ranno will enter pratfall if the object he has connected to breaks, barring bubble.

hitboxes.name: Swallow
notes: Interrupting Ranno during pull-in startup will knock grabbed character away.
After 36 intangible frames for both Ranno and opponent, the swallowed character will reappear trapped in bubble.
Bubble has a base time of 40 frames before a character escapes.
Each stack of poison adds an additional 40 frames in bubble.
Characters in bubble have their double jump refreshed.
Late/Shoulder hitboxes disappear 1f after releasing attack f17- if the attack has not yet hit another character or object.
When hitting another character or object, Shovel Knight will bounce and Dair will remain active for a further 11 frames before you are able to begin the endlag state.
Unique interactions after bouncing off of both Lily, causing her to bite, and Absa's cloud, pushing it down slightly.

hitboxes.name: Cast Anchor
notes: Air brakes f15-.

hitboxes.name: Reel Anchor
notes: Must be idle for 20 frames before you can reel in a treasure.
After idling with the anchor on the ground for 180 frames the anchor will automatically reel in.
On catch, reel f1-12 for a Golden Troupple Fish, f13-16 for a treasure pile.
You can only down-special once per airtime.
Anchor will continue travelling during hitpause.
Hitbox detection is active while travelling, however the hitbox itself only becomes active on hitting a character and the anchor cannot otherwise break projectiles.
Can hit the same character once every 10 frames.
Becomes inactive on landing.

downSpecial.name: Treasure Pile
notes: Reeling in from frame 13 of a catch onwards will result in a Treasure Pile.
Treasure Pile has 20 health in total and reduces in size slightly every 4 damage that's dealt to it.
Only one treasure pile can be active at once, and reeling in a new one will cause the previous one to disappear.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1 (Falling)
notes: Holding upwards on the left stick on frame 6 will cause Shovel Knight to jump higher, allowing him to reach standard sized platforms.
The charge window for Down Strong begins in the air and raises Shovel Knight's vertical position for 1 extra frame, allowing him to reach the platforms on Abyssal Gates.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

hitboxes.name: Hit 2 (Landing)
notes: If you land before Hit 1 is active, you will instead go straight to Hit 2.

Dynamo Mail allows you to use Down Strong in the air. Performing Down Strong immediately after jump-squat when Dynamo Mail is active performs a super jump Down Strong, with height variations for short hop and full hop.

hitboxes.name: Hit 2
notes: Has an indentically sized hitbox which can only hit projectiles. This hitbox has a higher priority value and a knockback angle of 80. This hitbox can move Kragg/Shovel Knight Rocks.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: If looping the attack you must hit your opponent or an object to cancel into Forward Air Hit 2.

hitboxes.name: Hit 2
notes: Can cancel into Forward Air Hit 1 on hit to loop the attack.
Transitions into Forward Tilt when landing in all stages of the move, making this move have no landing lag.
Dynamo Mail allows you to use Forward Strong in the air. You cannot cancel the move by landing during startup, active frames, or endlag, meaning it perfectly transitions into a grounded attack.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: If looping the attack you must hit your opponent or an object to cancel into Forward Tilt Hit 2.

hitboxes.name: Hit 2
notes: Can cancel into Forward Tilt Hit 1 on hit to loop the attack.
Can transition into jab if landing during startup, replacing landing lag with jab's endlag.
Once captured, coins cannot change ownership and will travel to Shovel Knight even if he is interrupted.

neutralSpecial.name: War Horn
notes: Air brakes during active frames.

hitboxes.name: Throw
notes: You can control the trajectory of the gear by holding a horizontal or vertical direction on the left stick, allowing Shovel Knight to throw the gear in 5 different arcs.

Cooldown applies on the last frame of endlag and is only relevant if the gear is destroyed or despawned sooner than 120 frames, otherwise the gear is throwable immediately on the previous one hitting entering the blastzone.

hitboxes.name: Mobile
notes: If Mobile Gear's path is blocked, it will lose its hitbox and disappear 50 frames later. Unblocking its path will not make it mobile again.
On parrying a Ghost Glove, it will become transcendent when being reflected, allowing it to break other projectiles on its return.

neutralSpecial.name: Ghost Glove
notes: If airborne, frames 16 and 17 will stall when reaching the ground and prevent you from landing until frame 18.
Landing anytime from frame 18 onwards during the remaining frames of endlag will cause you to immediately cancel into default landing lag.

calculator.description: Calculate travel duration, speed, damage, and knockback scaling
Calculate travel duration, speed, damage, and knockback scaling
Calculate travel duration, speed, damage, and knockback scaling

notes: Holding down on any actionable frame during either the hit/bounce animation or during jump-cancel's momentum will cancel the animation and slow Shovel Knight's aerial momentum to his usual amount.
Holding back on the same frame you jump-cancel will cause Shovel Knight to turnaround on the first frame of jump-squat, allowing him to face the opposite direction in the air.

A 30 frame cooldown applies on the final frame of endlag if you are in the air on whiff. On hit or after bouncing all versions of Forward Special will apply a 40 frame cooldown on the first frame of endlag, which is effectively a 29 frame cooldown once you are actionable.

sideSpecial.name: Infinidagger
notes: Infinidagger is locked in if special is held until the 96th frame of startup, which immediately starts the 2 frame startup window before releasing.
Travels much faster than partially charging forward-special.
Holding down on any actionable frame during either the hit/bounce animation or during jump-cancel's momentum will cancel the animation and slow Shovel Knight's aerial momentum to his usual amount.
Holding back on the same frame you jump-cancel will cause Shovel Knight to turnaround on the first frame of jump-squat, allowing him to face the opposite direction in the air.

A 30 frame cooldown applies on the final frame of endlag if you are in the air on whiff. On hit or after bouncing all versions of Forward Special will apply a 40 frame cooldown on the first frame of endlag, which is effectively a 29 frame cooldown once you are actionable.
Right stick binds: Left = War Horn, Up = Mobile Gear, Right = Mail of Momentum, Down = Dynamo Mail.
Purchasing an item will make it free for the remainder of the game if you choose to repurchase it, despite not being reflected in the UI.

hitboxes.name: Final Hit
notes: Will replace the next attack in hit 1's loop on releasing attack.

hitboxes.name: Final Hit (Tip)
notes: Will replace the next attack in hit 1's loop on releasing attack.
Up Air will loop hit 1 up to 4 times while holding attack. This allows you to delay the final hit, connect hit 1 multiple times and will lift Shovel Knight into the air.
Dagger hilt has higher knockback than the tip.

hitboxes.name: Hit 3 (Rising)
notes: Same hitbox group as Hit 2, meaning you cannot hit a character with this hitbox if they were previously hit by Hit 2.

hitboxes.name: Hit 4 (Falling)
notes: Fast-fall window assumes that Up Special does not hit a ceiling during the rising section of the move.
Unable to land and refresh resources until 58-.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

notes: Dynamo Mail allows you to use Up Strong in the air. You cannot cancel the move by landing during startup, active frames, or endlag, meaning it perfectly transitions into a grounded attack.
When moved with Up Strong, damage and knockback scales with with the charge damage multiplier, causing it to deal 1.25x total knockback when creating it and 1.6x damage (6%).
Retains a hitbox until landed, spikes while falling.

upStrong.name: Rock
notes: Spawns only if Up Strong is fully charged (while on the ground).
Can angle the initial arc on creation by holding a horizontal direction.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: As Up Tilt counts as a projectile, Shovel Knight does not suffer any hitpause on hitting another character with it.
Bair will extend directly outwards or can be angled up or down by the player. It is possible to aim Bair using the right stick, which takes priority over your left stick input.

backAir.name: Pin
notes: You can pin with extending hits, with the pin taking 1 frame to confirm (this can be either during the active frames or as an additional frame of endlag).
Can remain pinned for 96 frames before it is automatically cancelled.
Maintains grass as if grounded if pinned onto a surface with grass on it. Pinning the wall maintains grass on the stage floor.

Landing during unpin cancel endlag will incur whiff landing lag even if the attack hit an opponent prior to this. Allowing pin to end naturally will cause landing lag to consider if the move had hit an opponent or whiffed prior to the pin.

downSpecial.name: Howl
notes: Howl activates grass outwards in a circular radius around Sylvanos every frame after f16.
Grass is unable to disappear once Howl has begun.
Interrupting Sylvanos anytime before frame 16 will prevent any grass from spawning roots, and reset all active grass to its full 60 frame timer.

Interrupting Sylvanos anytime from frame 16 onwards will prevent any further grass from spawning hitboxes, however any grass which is in its root startup state will still spawn its 1 frame hitbox and become inactive for 180 frames.

hitboxes.name: Tail Swipe
notes: Endlag based on projectile, not physical hit.

hitboxes.name: Seed Shot
notes: You can control the horizontal and vertical trajectory of the seed by holding any direction on the left stick before it spawns.

forwardTilt.name: Flower
notes: Maintains all grass on the current platform or ground it is occupying, preventing it from being removed if Sylvanos leaves that surface for too long.
Can have 3 flowers placed at a time, with the oldest flower being removed from play if a new flower is spawned (seeds can still be spawned freely).
A spawned flower will grow a small patch of grass, likewise, destroying flower will also destroy a small area of grass, unless the grass is currently inactive.
If the ground beneath a flower disappears it will snap to the nearest ground within 32px, otherwise it will be destroyed.
Hitting only a flower will cause the players move to have halved hitpause.
Grass will spawn beneath Sylvanos while he is grounded. This grass will stay so long as Sylvanos is grounded, but only remains for 60 frames after Sylvanos has left the ground before disappearing.

You can maintain grass using flowers to prevent it from despawning by having one planted on the same level that the grass exists. It is also possible to maintain grass by using Bair to pin into the ground or platform or by pinning into the wall, which will keep all grass on ground-level active.

Jab Special Finisher will spawn a wave of petals, creating grass behind them if none already exists.- To perform Up Special's bite there must be active grass on that part of the ground. Grass will also decrease the endlag of emerging out of Up Specials' burrow without attacking with the bite.
Sylvanos will eat active grass during forward special and is able to loop the attack for the full length of grass by holding special.

Down Special spawns roots out of the grass to attack anyone in their path, which then causes grass to become inactive for 180 frames, after which despawning completely. On inputting Down Special, all active grass is prevented from becoming inactive until the Howl reaches it to summon roots. If Sylvanos is interrupted prior during Down Special's initial startup all active grass will be reset to it's 60 frame lifetime.
Inactive grass does not provide any of the benefits that active grass provides and all moves or their properties which require grass will not be usable on it.
Upon being destroyed, a flower will remove all active grass in the small area surrounding it.
Dying will remove all flowers and all grass.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

hitboxes.name: Tail Swipe
notes: Interrupting Sylvanos prevents Petal Wave from spawning.

hitboxes.name: Petal Wave
notes: Grass is spawned behind the wave of petals as they travel accross the ground.

jab.name: Jab Special Finisher
notes: Replaces Jab 3

hitboxes.name: Seed Shot
notes: You can control the horizontal and vertical trajectory of the seed by holding any direction on the left stick before it spawns.

neutralSpecial.name: Flower
notes: Maintains all grass on the current platform or ground it is occupying, preventing it from being removed if Sylvanos leaves that surface for too long.
Can have 3 flowers placed at a time, with the oldest flower being removed from play if a new flower is spawned (seeds can still be spawned freely).
A spawned flower will grow a small patch of grass, likewise, destroying flower will also destroy a small area of grass, unless the grass is currently inactive.
If the ground beneath a flower disappears it will snap to the nearest ground within 32px, otherwise it will be destroyed.
Hitting only a flower will cause the players move to have halved hitpause.

sideSpecial.name: Beast Dash
notes: Holding special while on grass on the 2nd frame of endlag allows you to continue the attack until either releasing special, no grass remains or you become airborne.
Sylvanos spawns grass behind him if there isn't any or he eats any grass beneath him from f14 onwards.
Hitting another character or object will prevent Sylvanos from entering pratfall at the end of the move.
Holding either horizontal direction allows you to increase or decrease the move's travel speed.

hitboxes.name: Instant Burrow
notes: Holding the special button when performing up-special while grounded allows Sylvanos to instantly burrow into the ground, skipping the dive section of the move.

hitboxes.name: Emerge
notes: You have full control to move under the stage during intangible frames.
Hold special f16 to Bite, hold taunt to emerge with taunt.

hitboxes.name: Ground
notes: Continues off ledges, transitioning into Dash Attack (Air).

hitboxes.name: Air
notes: Landing transitions into Dash Attack (Ground).

hitboxes.name: Hit 1 (Airborne)
notes: Landing on the 2nd frame of endlag causes Wrastor to slide forward slightly, which is referred to as a 'Perfect Height' Down Special.
Remaining active frames + endlag jump-cancellable on hit.

hitboxes.name: Sour
notes: Landing after f51 will put Wrastor into 4 frames of whiff landing lag.

hitboxes.name: Hit 3
notes: Whiff endlag jump-cancellable if Hit 1/2 hit an object.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

neutralSpecial.name: Tornado
notes: On releasing special, any active hitboxes will be interrupted immediately and a single frame of startup will begin before the final hits become active.

sideSpecial.name: Slipstream
notes: Deals no hitstun against crouching opponents, allowing inputs to be queued for post-hitpause.
Slipstream height is 40px tall.

A 300 frame cooldown applies frame 2 of startup, meaning interrupting Wrastor before Slipstream is thrown will place it on cooldown. This 300 frame cooldown reapplies on the frame slipstream is thrown. If Wrastor's slipstream is destroyed by a physical attack or parried the 300 frame cooldown apply again.

hitboxes.name: Sweet
notes: Wrastor is always able to b-reverse his up-special during or after the sweetspot hitbox to change which direction he travels.

hitboxes.name: Sour
notes: Landing after f54 will put Wrastor into 4 frames of whiff landing lag.

hitboxes.name: Front
notes: Remaining active frames + endlag jump-cancellable on hit.

hitboxes.name: Above
notes: Remaining active frames + endlag jump-cancellable on hit.

hitboxes.name: Spike
notes: Remaining active frames + endlag jump-cancellable on hit.
Up Strong may be input during hitpause to begin immediately after hitpause has ended.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1 (Aerial Dive)
notes: Zetterburn will flash white when his double jump is restored.
Wavebounce does shift momentum.

untechable.note: Forces a missed tech instead of bouncing the opponent off the ground.

hitboxes.name: Fire Puddle
notes: Activates on the 4th active frame of Hit 2. Ledge-cancelling the attack before this frame will result in the fire puddle not activating.
You are able to drift during the initial flip if your horizontal speed is lowered by hitting the wall or another object.
Wavebounce does shift momentum.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Pulls opponents in during hitpause.

hitboxes.name: Fire Combustion
notes: Does not replace a hitbox, but instead adds a new one if it detects the struck opponent is on fire.
Fire is removed frame 180, on parry, or if consumed by any of Zetterburn's strong attacks.
Timer is paused while the on-fire character is in hitstun.
Tick timing may vary slightly post-hitpause due to unknown reasons.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Pulls opponents in during hitpause.

hitboxes.name: Fire Combustion
notes: Does not replace a hitbox, but instead adds a new one if it detects the struck opponent is on fire.

hitboxes.name: Hit 1
notes: Pulls opponents inwards during hitpause.

Jab combos have varying startup depending on when the attack is input. A jab input within the final 2 frames of the cancel window will not begin its startup until after the remaining frames of endlag are completed.

neutralSpecial.name: Shine
notes: Jumping during hitpause will always buffer a jump after hitpause ends.

hitboxes.name: Projectile
notes: Cooldown applied first frame of endlag.

hitboxes.name: Travelling
notes: Can be angled in 24 possible directions.
Cancelling by angling into the ground will cause the move to become inactive and Zetterburn to enter 10 frames of endlag, including time in a shortened landing lag state.
Will only travel through platforms.

hitboxes.name: Fire Combustion
notes: Does not replace a hitbox, but instead adds a new one if it detects the struck opponent is on fire.
